org.assertj.swing.fixture
Class AbstractButtonFixture<S,T extends AbstractButton>

java.lang.Object
  org.assertj.swing.fixture.AbstractComponentFixture<S,T,D>
      org.assertj.swing.fixture.AbstractJComponentFixture<S,T,D>
          org.assertj.swing.fixture.AbstractJPopupMenuInvokerFixture<S,T,AbstractButtonDriver>
              org.assertj.swing.fixture.AbstractButtonFixture<S,T>
Type Parameters:
S - used to simulate "self types." For more information please read "Emulating 'self types' using Java Generics to simplify fluent API implementation."
T - the type of AbstractButton that this fixture can manage.
All Implemented Interfaces:
JComponentFixture<S>, JPopupMenuInvokerFixture, MouseInputSimulationFixture<S>, TextDisplayFixture<S>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AbstractTwoStateButtonFixture, JButtonFixture
public abstract class AbstractButtonFixture<S,T extends AbstractButton>
extends AbstractJPopupMenuInvokerFixture<S,T,AbstractButtonDriver>
implements TextDisplayFixture<S>

Supports functional testing of AbstractButtons.

Author:
Yvonne Wang, Alex Ruiz

AbstractButtonFixture

public AbstractButtonFixture(@Nonnull
                             Class<S> selfType,
                             @Nonnull
                             Robot robot,
                             @Nonnull
                             T target)
Creates a new AbstractButtonFixture.

Parameters:
selfType - the "self type."
target - the JButton to be managed by this fixture.
robot - performs simulation of user events on the given AbstractButton.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if robot is null.
NullPointerException - if target is null.

AbstractButtonFixture

public AbstractButtonFixture(@Nonnull
                             Class<S> selfType,
                             @Nonnull
                             Robot robot,
                             @Nullable
                             String buttonName,
                             @Nonnull
                             Class<? extends T> type)
Creates a new AbstractButtonFixture.

Parameters:
selfType - the "self type."
robot - performs simulation of user events on a AbstractButton.
buttonName - the name of the AbstractButton to find using the given RobotFixture.
type - the type of the AbstractButton to find using the given Robot.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if robot is null.
NullPointerException - if type is null.
ComponentLookupException - if a matching AbstractButton could not be found.
ComponentLookupException - if more than one matching AbstractButton is found.

Asserts that the text of this fixture's AbstractButton matches the specified value.

Specified by:

Parameters:

Returns:

Throws:

Asserts that the text of this fixture's AbstractButton matches the given regular expression pattern.

Parameters:
pattern - the regular expression pattern to match.
Returns:
this fixture.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if the given regular expression pattern is null.
